channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Is Weakly-supervised Action Segmentation Ready For Human-Robot Interaction? No, Let's Improve It With Action-union Learning
item.description: To alleviate this issue, we proposed a novel learning pattern in our training stage, which maximizes the probability of action union of surrounding timestamps for unlabeled frames.

item.title: Discretize Relaxed Solution of Spectral Clustering via a Non-Heuristic Algorithm
item.description: Unfortunately, the goal of the existing methods is not to find a discrete solution that minimizes the original objective.

item.title: PAC Prediction Sets Under Label Shift
item.description: We propose a novel algorithm for constructing prediction sets with PAC guarantees in the label shift setting.

item.title: TabuLa: Harnessing Language Models for Tabular Data Synthesis
item.description: Results show that Tabula averagely reduces 46. 2% training time per epoch comparing to current LLMs-based state-of-the-art algorithm and consistently achieves even higher synthetic data utility.

item.title: How a student becomes a teacher: learning and forgetting through Spectral methods
item.description: In theoretical ML, the teacher-student paradigm is often employed as an effective metaphor for real-life tuition.

item.title: An Improved Metarounding Algorithm via Frank-Wolfe
item.description: Metarounding is an approach to convert an approximation algorithm for linear optimization over some combinatorial classes to an online linear optimization algorithm for the same class.

item.title: Identifying and Adapting Transformer-Components Responsible for Gender Bias in an English Language Model
item.description: Language models (LMs) exhibit and amplify many types of undesirable biases learned from the training data, including gender bias.

item.title: Transformer-based Entity Legal Form Classification
item.description: We propose the application of Transformer-based language models for classifying entity legal forms from raw legal entity names.

item.title: Neural networks for insurance pricing with frequency and severity data: a benchmark study from data preprocessing to technical tariff
item.description: We compare in detail the performance of: a generalized linear model on binned input data, a gradient-boosted tree model, a feed-forward neural network (FFNN), and the combined actuarial neural network (CANN).

item.title: DepWiGNN: A Depth-wise Graph Neural Network for Multi-hop Spatial Reasoning in Text
item.description: Spatial reasoning in text plays a crucial role in various real-world applications.

item.title: AgentTuning: Enabling Generalized Agent Abilities for LLMs
item.description: Though many prompting methods have been proposed to complete particular agent tasks, there is lack of research focusing on improving the agent capabilities of LLMs themselves without compromising their general abilities.

item.title: Mixing Histopathology Prototypes into Robust Slide-Level Representations for Cancer Subtyping
item.description: Whole-slide image analysis via the means of computational pathology often relies on processing tessellated gigapixel images with only slide-level labels available.

item.title: Not Just Learning from Others but Relying on Yourself: A New Perspective on Few-Shot Segmentation in Remote Sensing
item.description: In addition, to prevent the co-existence of multiple classes in remote sensing scenes from exacerbating the collapse of FSS generalization, we also propose a new Known-class Meta Suppressor (KMS) module to suppress the activation of known-class objects in the sample.

item.title: ExtSwap: Leveraging Extended Latent Mapper for Generating High Quality Face Swapping
item.description: We present a novel face swapping method using the progressively growing structure of a pre-trained StyleGAN.

item.title: Generating Robust Adversarial Examples against Online Social Networks (OSNs)
item.description: In this work, we aim to design a new framework for generating robust AEs that can survive the OSN transmission; namely, the AEs before and after the OSN transmission both possess strong attack capabilities.

item.title: Recoverable Privacy-Preserving Image Classification through Noise-like Adversarial Examples
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that 1) the classification accuracy of the classifier trained in the plaintext domain remains the same in both the ciphertext and plaintext domains; 2) the encrypted images can be recovered into their original form with an average PSNR of up to 51+ dB for the SVHN dataset and 48+ dB for the VGGFace2 dataset; 3) our system exhibits satisfactory generalization capability on the encryption, decryption and classification tasks across datasets that are different from the training one; and 4) a high-level of security is achieved against three potential threat models.

item.title: Click on Mask: A Labor-efficient Annotation Framework with Level Set for Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: Due to the small size of infrared targets, manual annotation consumes more resources and restricts the development of this field.

item.title: DA-TransUNet: Integrating Spatial and Channel Dual Attention with Transformer U-Net for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: This study proposes a novel deep medical image segmentation framework, called DA-TransUNet, aiming to introduce the Transformer and dual attention block into the encoder and decoder of the traditional U-shaped architecture.

item.title: Differentiable Vertex Fitting for Jet Flavour Tagging
item.description: We propose a differentiable vertex fitting algorithm that can be used for secondary vertex fitting, and that can be seamlessly integrated into neural networks for jet flavour tagging.

item.title: SemantIC: Semantic Interference Cancellation Towards 6G Wireless Communications
item.description: This letter proposes a novel anti-interference technique, semantic interference cancellation (SemantIC), for enhancing information quality towards the sixth-generation (6G) wireless networks.

item.title: FinEntity: Entity-level Sentiment Classification for Financial Texts
item.description: In this work, we introduce an entity-level sentiment classification dataset, called \textbf{FinEntity}, that annotates financial entity spans and their sentiment (positive, neutral, and negative) in financial news.

item.title: Towards Parsimonious Generative Modeling of RNA Families
item.description: Generative probabilistic models emerge as a new paradigm in data-driven, evolution-informed design of biomolecular sequences.

item.title: Putting the Object Back into Video Object Segmentation
item.description: The object queries act as a high-level summary of the target object, while high-resolution feature maps are retained for accurate segmentation.

item.title: The Foundation Model Transparency Index
item.description: We score 10 major foundation model developers (e. g. OpenAI, Google, Meta) against the 100 indicators to assess their transparency.

item.title: Eureka: Human-Level Reward Design via Coding Large Language Models
item.description: The generality of Eureka also enables a new gradient-free in-context learning approach to reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF), readily incorporating human inputs to improve the quality and the safety of the generated rewards without model updating.

item.title: ICU: Conquering Language Barriers in Vision-and-Language Modeling by Dividing the Tasks into Image Captioning and Language Understanding
item.description: Most multilingual vision-and-language (V&L) research aims to accomplish multilingual and multimodal capabilities within one model.

item.title: Causal Similarity-Based Hierarchical Bayesian Models
item.description: Common approaches for learning supervised models with heterogeneous datasets include learning a global model for the entire dataset, learning local models for each tasks' data, or utilising hierarchical, meta-learning and multi-task learning approaches to learn how to generalise from data pooled across multiple tasks.

item.title: Open-World Lifelong Graph Learning
item.description: We study the problem of lifelong graph learning in an open-world scenario, where a model needs to deal with new tasks and potentially unknown classes.

item.title: Multilingual estimation of political-party positioning: From label aggregation to long-input Transformers
item.description: We carry out the analysis of the Comparative Manifestos Project dataset across 41 countries and 27 languages and find that the task can be efficiently solved by state-of-the-art models, with label aggregation producing the best results.

item.title: Product Attribute Value Extraction using Large Language Models
item.description: E-commerce applications such as faceted product search or product comparison are based on structured product descriptions like attribute/value pairs.

item.title: DCSI -- An improved measure of cluster separability based on separation and connectedness
item.description: Detailed evaluation on frequently used real-world data sets shows that DCSI can correctly identify touching or overlapping classes that do not form meaningful clusters.

item.title: A Read-and-Select Framework for Zero-shot Entity Linking
item.description: Zero-shot entity linking (EL) aims at aligning entity mentions to unseen entities to challenge the generalization ability.

item.title: Are Structural Concepts Universal in Transformer Language Models? Towards Interpretable Cross-Lingual Generalization
item.description: We then propose a meta-learning-based method to learn to align conceptual spaces of different languages, which facilitates zero-shot and few-shot generalization in concept classification and also offers insights into the cross-lingual in-context learning phenomenon.

item.title: Improved Operator Learning by Orthogonal Attention
item.description: Neural operators, as an efficient surrogate model for learning the solutions of PDEs, have received extensive attention in the field of scientific machine learning.

item.title: Testing the Consistency of Performance Scores Reported for Binary Classification Problems
item.description: In this paper, we introduce numerical techniques to assess the consistency of reported performance scores and the assumed experimental setup.

item.title: SalUn: Empowering Machine Unlearning via Gradient-based Weight Saliency in Both Image Classification and Generation
item.description: The resultant method that we call saliency unlearning (SalUn) narrows the performance gap with 'exact' unlearning (model retraining from scratch after removing the forgetting dataset).

item.title: On the Representational Capacity of Recurrent Neural Language Models
item.description: We extend the Turing completeness result to the probabilistic case, showing how a rationally weighted RLM with unbounded computation time can simulate any probabilistic Turing machine (PTM).

item.title: Co$^2$PT: Mitigating Bias in Pre-trained Language Models through Counterfactual Contrastive Prompt Tuning
item.description: Pre-trained Language Models are widely used in many important real-world applications.

item.title: Quasi Manhattan Wasserstein Distance
item.description: The Quasi Manhattan Wasserstein Distance (QMWD) is a metric designed to quantify the dissimilarity between two matrices by combining elements of the Wasserstein Distance with specific transformations.

item.title: Lidar Panoptic Segmentation and Tracking without Bells and Whistles
item.description: Our network is modular by design and optimized for all aspects of both the panoptic segmentation and tracking task.

item.title: SDGym: Low-Code Reinforcement Learning Environments using System Dynamics Models
item.description: Understanding the long-term impact of algorithmic interventions on society is vital to achieving responsible AI.

item.title: Attack Prompt Generation for Red Teaming and Defending Large Language Models
item.description: Furthermore, we propose a defense framework that fine-tunes victim LLMs through iterative interactions with the attack framework to enhance their safety against red teaming attacks.

item.title: Mutual Information-Based Integrated Sensing and Communications: A WMMSE Framework
item.description: In this letter, a weighted minimum mean square error (WMMSE) empowered integrated sensing and communication (ISAC) system is investigated.

item.title: Real-Time Motion Prediction via Heterogeneous Polyline Transformer with Relative Pose Encoding
item.description: The real-world deployment of an autonomous driving system requires its components to run on-board and in real-time, including the motion prediction module that predicts the future trajectories of surrounding traffic participants.

item.title: DocXChain: A Powerful Open-Source Toolchain for Document Parsing and Beyond
item.description: In this report, we introduce DocXChain, a powerful open-source toolchain for document parsing, which is designed and developed to automatically convert the rich information embodied in unstructured documents, such as text, tables and charts, into structured representations that are readable and manipulable by machines.

item.title: Towards Real-World Streaming Speech Translation for Code-Switched Speech
item.description: Code-switching (CS), i. e. mixing different languages in a single sentence, is a common phenomenon in communication and can be challenging in many Natural Language Processing (NLP) settings.

item.title: Non-Autoregressive Sentence Ordering
item.description: Existing sentence ordering approaches generally employ encoder-decoder frameworks with the pointer net to recover the coherence by recurrently predicting each sentence step-by-step.

item.title: Prompt Injection Attacks and Defenses in LLM-Integrated Applications
item.description: As a result, the literature lacks a systematic understanding of prompt injection attacks and their defenses.

item.title: Character-level Chinese Backpack Language Models
item.description: The Backpack is a Transformer alternative shown to improve interpretability in English language modeling by decomposing predictions into a weighted sum of token sense components.

item.title: Representing and Computing Uncertainty in Phonological Reconstruction
item.description: Despite the inherently fuzzy nature of reconstructions in historical linguistics, most scholars do not represent their uncertainty when proposing proto-forms.
